<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 14.3 is: Controlling expressions shall not be invariant.
Here are exceptions to this rule:
1. Invariants that are used to create infinite loops are permitted.
2. A do-while loop with an essentially Boolean controlling expression that evaluates to false and satisfies the constraints and semantics for an integer constant expression is permitted.
</misra_rule>

<target_code>
Here is the code of OS_DoSelect:
```c
static int32 OS_DoSelect(int maxfd, fd_set *rd_set, fd_set *wr_set, int32 msecs)
{
    int             os_status;
    int32           return_code;
    struct timeval  tv;
    struct timeval *tvptr;
    struct timespec ts_now;
    struct timespec ts_end;

    if (msecs > 0)
    {
        clock_gettime(CLOCK_MONOTONIC, &ts_now);
        ts_end.tv_sec  = ts_now.tv_sec + (msecs / 1000);
        ts_end.tv_nsec = ts_now.tv_nsec + (1000000 * (msecs % 1000));
        if (ts_end.tv_nsec >= 1000000000)
        {
            ++ts_end.tv_sec;
            ts_end.tv_nsec -= 1000000000;
        }
    }
    else
    {
        /* Zero for consistency and to avoid possible confusion if not cleared */
        memset(&ts_end, 0, sizeof(ts_end));
    }

    do
    {
        if (msecs < 0)
        {
            tvptr = NULL;
        }
        else if (msecs == 0)
        {
            tvptr      = &tv;
            tv.tv_sec  = 0;
            tv.tv_usec = 0;
        }
        else
        {
            tvptr = &tv;

            clock_gettime(CLOCK_MONOTONIC, &ts_now);

            /* note that the tv_sec and tv_usec/tv_nsec values are all signed longs, so OK to subtract */
            tv.tv_sec  = ts_end.tv_sec - ts_now.tv_sec;
            tv.tv_usec = (ts_end.tv_nsec - ts_now.tv_nsec) / 1000;

            if (tv.tv_sec < 0 || (tv.tv_sec == 0 && tv.tv_usec < 0))
            {
                os_status = 0;
                break;
            }

            if (tv.tv_usec < 0)
            {
                tv.tv_usec += 1000000;
                --tv.tv_sec;
            }
        }

        os_status = select(maxfd + 1, rd_set, wr_set, NULL, tvptr);
    } while (os_status < 0 && (errno == EINTR || errno == EAGAIN));

    if (os_status < 0)
    {
        return_code = OS_ERROR;
    }
    else if (os_status == 0)
    {
        return_code = OS_ERROR_TIMEOUT;
    }
    else
    {
        return_code = OS_SUCCESS;
    }

    return return_code;
}
```

explanation: Only the do-while loop is a loop controlling expression in this function; it is the sole potential candidate for Rule 14.3 and therefore reported for investigation. All other conditional expressions (e.g. if (msecs > 0), if (msecs < 0), else if (msecs == 0), the internal if checks on tv.tv_sec/tv.tv_usec) depend on the input parameter msecs and/or runtime values from clock_gettime and computed time differences — they are not constant/invariant at compile time and thus do not raise Rule 14.3 concerns. No other for/while/do-loop controlling expressions or constant-loop constructs are present in the function.
